alert.note: Alert for Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 9:46AM CDT until July 13 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Cimarron River near Ripley affecting Payne County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO THURSDAY EVENING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cimarron River near Ripley. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Places along the Cimarron River valley in Payne County are briefly flooded. Agricultural lands and oil wells located near the channel are isolated by water in cutoff channels along the river valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 16.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 17.0 feet early this afternoon then fall to 15.2 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then rise again to flood stage early Thursday afternoon. It will fall for the remainder of the period. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM CDT.
